definition: war of resistance, especially the war against Japan (1937-1945)

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan, Tsinghua University was removed from Kunming to Beiping in 1946.
sentences.chinese: 清華大學在抗戰勝利後的1946年由昆明遷回北平。

sentences.english: We were bombed out during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰期間我們被炸得無家可歸。

sentences.english: Zhou Gucheng concerns himself with Chinas modernization from the period of the War of Resistence Against Japan.
sentences.chinese: 從抗戰時期起周谷城就關心國家的現代化問題。

sentences.english: This crisis can be overcome only if resistance is carried out jointly by the people and the government.
sentences.chinese: 惟有實行民衆和政府一致的抗戰，才能挽救這個危局。

sentences.english: Since 1937, he had been teaching in The South-Western United University in Kunming.
sentences.chinese: 1937年抗戰開始，他在昆明西南聯大任教。

sentences.english: We should acclaim and support the heroic resistance of Feng Chih-an's troops.
sentences.chinese: 我們應該讚揚和擁護馮治安部的英勇抗戰。

sentences.english: This temple served for an operating room during the Anti-Japanese War.
sentences.chinese: 在抗戰時期這座廟曾用來作手術室。

sentences.english: Shanghai's culture of Anti-Japanese War was a model in the development of the national culture.
sentences.chinese: 上海抗戰文化在全國文化發展中具有典型意義。

sentences.english: The 15-year-old recently passed away following a long fight with cancer.
sentences.chinese: 這15歲的孩子長期與癌症抗戰後，於曰前去世。

sentences.english: Therefore, the prospect of going over from partial to total resistance does exist.
sentences.chinese: 因此，從片面抗戰轉變到全面抗戰的前途是存在的。

sentences.english: Therefore, the prospect of going over from partial to total resistance does exist.
sentences.chinese: 因此，從片面抗戰轉變到全面抗戰的前途是存在的。

sentences.english: For a time, the roaring guns of the resistance at Lukouchiao decided the issue.
sentences.chinese: 盧溝橋抗戰的炮聲，把這個爭論暫時地解決了。

sentences.english: The application of the policy of armed resistance and of the above measures depends on this united front.
sentences.chinese: 執行抗戰的方針和上述各項政策，依靠這個聯合陣線。

sentences.english: After the War of Resistance Against Japan broke out, the thought of quintessence of Chinese traditional music declined rapidly too.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰全面爆發後，國粹主義音樂思潮也迅速走向衰落。

sentences.english: In Afghanistan, there have been no countermeasure, and munication technology at all.
sentences.chinese: 正在阿富汗，根柢講沒有上甚麼電子對抗戰通信足藝。

sentences.english: Ten years before the anti—Japanese war saw the formation of National government's policy on Tibet.
sentences.chinese: 抗戰前十年是國民政府對藏政策的形成時期。

definition: Chiang Kai-shek (1887-1975), military leader, head of the Nationalist government in China 1928-1949 and the government in exile on Taiwan 1950-1975
Chinese Nationalist Party 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] and Chinese Communist Party 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党/same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
